item.title: Today is the day for the landrush of .global, .website, and .press domain names
item.description: Starting August 27th, Singapore time, several top-level domain names will be up for grabs in a “landrush” phase, according to online brand specialist IP Mirror. The “sunrise” phase, reserved for trademark holders to register their brands, precedes this period. During the landrush phase, anyone can secure remaining domain names at a premium price. IP Mirror highlights “.global” as a particularly appealing option, signifying a broad international reach. This domain’s landrush phase lasts from August 27th to September 4th.

item.title: Abbott introduces the Freestyle Libre Pro System for glucose monitoring in India
item.description: Research from the Asia Diabetes Foundation (ADF) indicates a growing trend of type II diabetes among young adults in Asia. A collaborative study by the ADF and Merck, called the Joint Asia Diabetes Evaluation (JADE), revealed that 18% of participants from nine Asian countries and territories were diagnosed with diabetes before the age of 40. This condition is known as young-onset diabetes. While pharmaceutical company Merck offers the drug Janumet XR for type II diabetes treatment, healthcare company Abbott takes a different approach.

item.title: HTC introduces the Desire 616 dual SIM smartphone for entry-level users
item.description: HTC, a company known for mobile innovation and design, has introduced the HTC Desire 616 dual sim phone. This new phone offers high-end features at an affordable price.Â Source: HTC. “The HTC Desire 616 dual sim is a powerful phone with a great price tag,” says Jack Yang, President of HTC South Asia. “This new phone in the popular HTC Desire line offers an eight-core processor, fast processing speeds, and top-tier features at an accessible price, giving users a best-in-class experience.
